post_text: Over the past few weeks, RCECS teachers have created "Enrichment and Review Choice Boards" for students to continue learning at home during the school closure. We know that many parents are working long hours, may not have internet, or only have a smartphone to complete online learning. Because of this and based on parent and teacher feedback, we revised the choice boards starting next week. The new choice boards will only be 2 pages long, but they will be filled with more rigorous learning activities that you child can easily do at home. Structured learning assignments will be posted on websites that you can access using a smartphone. Teachers will also start video meetings with their classes. We hope that this new approach will help families during this very difficult time. Please take a few minutes to review the pictures attached to this post. There are documents in English and Spanish for Grades K-2 and Grades 3-5. As always, RCECS is here to help and support not only your child, but your whole family.

Families: Please review the message below from our school's Attendance Committee

Dear Parents and Families,
If your child is absent from school, please fill out the yellow slip pictured below or provide a handwritten note. For the absence to be considered "excused ", it must meet one of the following reasons:
-Sickness of the child (Fever over 100 degrees, Vomiting, Diarrhea, etc.)
- Doctor's appointment
- Death in the family
- Other situations may be considered excused upon review from administration.

All other reasons for absences will be considered "unexcused." The yellow slip or written note must be handed in within three days of the absence or the absence will automatically become unexcused. Please put the yellow slip or the written note in your child's take home/homework folder, so it is easy for their teacher to locate.

If you have any questions regarding attention, please call the main office.
